alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 20 at 2:39AM MDT until April 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...STRONG SPRING STORM POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND... .A robust spring storm developing over the northern Plains late this week may bring heavy snow accumulations and strong winds to portions of northeastern Wyoming and northwestern South Dakota, including the Black Hills, this weekend. Snow accumulations over 6 inches and northwest wind gusts up to 60 mph will be possible beginning late Friday night and continuing through the weekend. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of over 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeastern Wyoming and northwestern South Dakota, including the central and northern Black Hills and Bear Lodge Mountains. * WHEN...From late Friday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
